title: 112_hr3351
content: The Act titled "Franchise Education for Veterans Act" allows the use of educational assistance for franchise training. The GI Bill now includes various training programs for individuals not on active duty, such as apprenticeship, on-job training, cooperative programs, and training at approved establishments for franchises. The GI Bill now covers training programs at approved establishments for franchises, with limitations on the amount of educational assistance payable. The GI Bill now covers training programs at approved establishments for franchises, with limitations on the amount of educational assistance payable, including a monthly stipend for housing and additional funds for books, supplies, equipment, and other educational costs. The GI Bill covers training programs at approved establishments for franchises, with limitations on educational assistance payments based on the individual's entitlement. The Secretary adjusts the amount payable to reflect the difference in educational assistance rates for eligible individuals. The Post-9/11 GI Bill limits educational assistance for veterans to 12 months and $15,000 total. Amendments include adding franchise training programs and adjusting payment amounts based on entitlement. The Post-9/11 GI Bill limits educational assistance for veterans to 12 months and $15,000 total, with adjustments for training programs at specified establishments. The Post-9/11 GI Bill provides educational assistance for veterans limited to 12 months and $15,000 total, with adjustments for training programs at specified establishments, including a monthly stipend based on housing allowance for E-5 grade members with dependents. The Post-9/11 GI Bill offers educational assistance to veterans, including a monthly stipend of $83 for training expenses or $15,000 total. The stipend amount varies based on the individual's entitlement to educational assistance. The Post-9/11 GI Bill provides educational assistance to veterans, with a monthly stipend amount based on entitlement. Veterans cannot receive more than 12 months or exceed $15,000 in total educational assistance under this program. Additional payment details are outlined in Section 3313(g)(4)(C) of the title. Payment for education program at a training establishment described in section 3452(e)(2) is made to the individual upon the Secretary receiving a certification of enrollment from the establishment.
